conjecture: The sum of an odd and an even integer is odd.
If x is an even integer and y is an odd integer, then x² + y² is odd.
The quotient of a rational number and a non-zero rational number is a rational number.
For every integer n, if n² is odd, then n is odd.
If x and y are integers such that 3 does not divide xy, then 3 does not divide xy.
For every real number x, if x is irrational, then -x is also irrational
Prove that √(2)/2 is irrational. You may use the fact that √2 is irrational in your proof.
If a group of 9 people won a total of 100 trophies, then at least one of the 9 kids has won at least 12 trophies.
There is no largest negative rational number.
There is no largest negative rational number.
If n > 4 is a composite number, n | (n - 1)!.
Consider a simple connected planar graph with e edges and v > 2 vertices. If e < 3v - 6, then there is a face of size at least 4 (that is, there exists a face bounded by at least 4 edges).
Prove that √(2) is irrational.
Prove the Pythagorean theorem (a²+b²=c², where a and b are the legs and c is the hypotenuse of a right triangle).

Given the definition of the Fibbonaci sequence:
f(0) = 1, f(1) = 1, f(n) = f(n - 1) + f(n - 2) for n ≥ 2,
f(n) ≥ (4/3)ⁿ⁻¹.
Given that, if x, y ∈ F, x² + y ∈ F and x - y² ∈ F, every element of F is divisible by 6.
If you draw n straight lines in a plane, you only need two colors to color the regions formed so that no two regions that have a common edge have a common color.
At most mn - 1 splits are necessary to divide a rectangle made up of m x n squares.
For any positive integer n, 6 evenly divides 7ⁿ-1.
For n ≥ 2, 3ⁿ > 2ⁿ + n².
